data.name: Calculate Euler's Constant ( e ) with a given Tolerance
data.description:
Calculate Euler's Constant ( e ) with a given Tolerance
---

[Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E_(mathematical_constant))

Briefly, e is a mathematical constant used in calculus, and is one of the numbers in Euler's identity:
![e^πi + 1 = 0](https://sites.google.com/site/technotesdave/_/rsrc/1472860620774/e-is-for-euler/eulers_eq.PNG)

One of the formulas for e is:

![e = lim(n->∞)((1+1/n)^n)](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS7xuEPL3po8BAe_pcSmbSXdzGL8RVpx-NBXXAc1KIghn1Awx6E&s)

Your task is this: given n, return the value of (1+1/n)^n **( to 10 decimal places )**

If ```n = Infinity``` just return ```Math.E```

## All inputs are valid
Function should be called ```e()```
